Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cell
      • Wall

  • public class Wall
extends Cell
    Characters and enemies are not allowed to walk onto Wall tiles. The Wall class is a subclass of the Cell class.
    Creation Date: 20/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 6/12/19.
    Version:
    2.2
    Author:
    Timothy Roger (977422), Nihal Goindi (976005), Joseph Pugh (975656)

      • isEmptySpace

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wall

        public Wall()
        Constructs a Wall instance. If this is called it means the Wall is not empty space.

      • Wall

        public Wall(boolean b)
        Constructs a Wall instance. This version of the constructor allows setting of the Wall instance being an space.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean - needs to be true if the Wall instance being constructed is an empty space.

    • Method Detail

      • accessCheck

        public boolean accessCheck(Character c)
        Since wall tiles can never be moved onto by the player, this method is Overriden from Cell and the return value is set to false.
        Overrides:
        accessCheck in class Cell
        Parameters:
        c - Character - the character instance being used in the level.
        Returns:
        the boolean value relating to the Cell's accessibility.

      • isEmptySpace

        public boolean isEmptySpace()
        Returns the indicator of empty space of the wall cell.
        Returns:
        the boolean value indicating if the Wall is an empty space.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws the wall tile.
        Overrides:
        draw in class Cell
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the correct image folder.
        gc - GraphicsContext - where to draw to.
        x - int - the x coordinate at which to draw.
        y - int - the y coordinate at which to draw.

      • image

        protected javafx.scene.image.Image image(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER)
        Returns the Image of the Cell. Can be either a wall image or an space image.
        Specified by:
        image in class Cell
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the correct image folder.
        Returns:
        the found wall or empty space image.

      • detailImage

        private javafx.scene.image.Image detailImage(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER)
        Returns the image of details to be drawn ontop of the space tile.
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the image folder to be used.
        Returns:
        the found detail Image.
